intro: Chlorophytum benuense, commonly known as the Benuense Spider Plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its long, arching leaves that resemble spider legs, hence its common name. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers in clusters, which are followed by blue or purple berries. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate to bright indirect light for optimal growth. Chlorophytum benuense is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
